name: CodeDeployDeployApplication
description: Deploys an application to Amazon EC2 instance(s) using AWS CodeDeploy
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [AWS CodeDeploy User Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/codedeploy/latest/userguide/) for more information on working with AWS CodeDeploy.

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS credentials to use. If needed, click on 'Manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'.

inputs.name: applicationName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the AWS CodeDeploy application.

inputs.name: deploymentGroupName
inputs.label: Deployment Group Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the deployment group to deploy to.

inputs.name: revisionBundle
inputs.label: Revision Bundle
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The artifacts to be deployed.

You can supply a folder or a filename to this parameter. If a folder is supplied the task will zip the contents of the folder recursively into an archive file before uploading the archive to Amazon S3. If a filename is supplied the task uploads it, unmodified, to Amazon S3. Note that CodeDeploy requires the appspec.yml file describing the application to exist at the root of the specified folder or archive file.

inputs.name: bucketName
inputs.label: Bucket Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the bucket to which the revision bundle will be will be uploaded.

inputs.name: bundlePrefix
inputs.label: Target Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional folder (key prefix) for the uploaded revision bundle in the bucket. If not specified the bundle will be uploaded to the root of the bucket.

inputs.name: fileExistsBehavior
inputs.label: Existing File Behavior
inputs.helpMarkDown: How AWS CodeDeploy should handle files that already exist in a deployment target location but weren't part of the previous successful deployment.

options.OVERWRITE: Overwrite the version already on the instance with the version in the new application revision
options.RETAIN: Keep the version already on the instance as part of the new deployment

inputs.name: updateOutdatedInstancesOnly
inputs.label: Update Outdated Instances Only
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked deploys to only those instances that are not running the latest application revision.

inputs.name: ignoreApplicationStopFailures
inputs.label: Ignore Application Stop Failures
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked then if the deployment causes the ApplicationStop deployment lifecycle event to an instance to fail, the deployment to that instance will not be considered to have failed at that point and will continue on to the BeforeInstall deployment lifecycle event.

inputs.name: outputVariable
inputs.label: Output Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the variable that will contain the deployment ID on task completion. The variable can be used as $(variableName) to refer to the function result in subsequent tasks.

inputs.name: logRequest
inputs.label: Log Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, request headers and other data for calls to AWS services are logged to the task's debug log.

inputs.name: logResponse
inputs.label: Log Response
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the response metadata and body content of non-streaming responses from calls to AWS services are output to the task's debug log. The unique request ID, which can be useful when contacting AWS for support, is always logged to the task output regardless of this option setting.

messages.UploadingBundle: Uploading revision bundle %s to object %s in bucket %s
messages.BundleUploadFailed: Upload of revision bundle failed with error: %s
messages.DeploymentStarted: Started deployment of new revision to deployment group %s for application %s, deployment ID %s
messages.DeploymentError: Request to deploy new revision returned error: %s
messages.SettingOutputVariable: Setting output variable %s with the ID of the deployment
messages.DeploymentGroupDoesNotExist: Deployment group %s does not exist for application %s
messages.CreatingDeploymentBundleArchiveFromFolde: Creating deployment bundle archive from build output at %s
messages.DeletingUploadedBundle: Deleting uploaded bundle %s created by task
